website_summaries.verdict: Best for beginners who require clear, easy-to-follow instructions.
pros: Step-by-step instructions are clear and easy to follow
Clear color photos are helpful reference points
Book covers a range of tricks from simply sitting down and rolling over to more complicated tricks, like picking up a tissue and fetching a beer
cons: Many of the advanced tricks will take a lot of time and dedication

customer_reviews.title: Missing steps, need very trainable pooch
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers are correct that there aren't enough intermediate steps for many dogs. For very responsive dogs, this might be enough. For instance, there is a trick where the dog fetches a tissue and the first step is "point at the tissue until the dog picks it up". For my dog, it's going to be a very long wait to get that tissue.
customer_reviews.author: m_flamingo

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant book
customer_reviews.text: I got my first puppy a few weeks ago. I bought this book in anticipation. By 10 weeks old he has learned sit, down, stay, come, roll over, shake paws and fetch. Granted he is a collie and very smart but this book lays an easy to follow step by step guide to every trick.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Quantity of "tricks" diminishes quality of instructions
customer_reviews.text: I like ... - step by step instructions - visual cue pictures - some useful tips Don't like - too many steps are missing! The leap from taking a basic step toward the end trick is fairly significant in some cases. I also purchased a book on scent-oriented games, which detailed some of the same activities (ie find the keys) in much greater detail -- and, in my mind, more effectively. I think this book might be a starting point if you have a highly motivated and intelligent dog (poodle, lab, etc.), but the tricks explained are not great for me and my hound.
customer_reviews.author: flaneur3

customer_reviews.title: One trained puppy coming up!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I have had dogs for 50 years, but this is definitely the best, most fun, training book I've had. The instructions are clear, and I have a number of successes already even though my Shih Tzu puppy is still only four months old. To add to the fun, many of the commands include the hand signal as well. Since I purchased this, I've also bought several other books by this author. She definitely has a gift for giving clear, easy to follow instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, clear, helpful photos of each step for each trick
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. Great photos, great descriptions, the tricks are listed by difficulty, and it even lists prerequisites for advanced tricks. The author also gives some "troubleshooting" advice in little bubbles on the page. Well written, not wordy. You can read about a trick, conveniently laid out across 2 pages and get the gist using the narrative or skip it and go right to the photos, which show every action. Really a very clear, powerful and well organized training resource book. It gives suggestion for voice commands and hand signals. It's almost as powerful as a video, and it achieves this using just 2 pages per trick!
customer_reviews.author: redparrot999

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift, and also purchased for a friend. It's very detailed with photos and step by step instructions plus troubleshooting tips, so very easy to use for first time dog owners, and even kids. Teaches verbal cues as well as hand motions. All the basics like sit, stay, lie down, come, drop it, and heel are included - as the rest of the tricks build on those - so can be used to begin basic manners training before fun tricks. Friend liked it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Best book for the dedicated trainer with a moderately to highly active dog
customer_reviews.text: Best for the dedicated trainer or someone who wants to teach a dog intensive tricks like obstacle courses. Also a great book to have when you first get your dog as a puppy. It's a step by step guide that is helpful and descriptive with hand motions and training methods. Also, it's a good way to learn what your dog's actions mean and what your actions mean to them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Several good ideas!
customer_reviews.text: I once checked this book out at the library. For the last few months, one of my dogs has been very sick (like cannot go outside for more than a potty break) and another dog has been a good sport but a bit restless. They like to be together as much as possible so I thought teaching the other dog some new exciting tricks will help. Several of these "tricks" he already does with my own hand gestures, which was pretty cool. We are working on opening the fridge door, putting toys away, etc. -Anne
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: Good tips for experienced owners, fantastic for "beginners"
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 7 years old and already knew quite a few commands. The beginning of the book reinforces a lot of training tricks you pick up and extends off them. It serves as a great reminder to keep those tactics on hand whenever your with your dog. The first trick I went with was teaching my dog to beg. Using her tip for standing behind the dog, I was able to teach my dog this in a few sessions. I think many tricks in this book are a little obvious but it doesn't help to read her take on them. Love the book overall!
customer_reviews.author: Joe feocco

customer_reviews.title: Trained my Vizsla Puppy With This
customer_reviews.text: This book was fun and awesome for training my Vizsla. You might be able to YouTube everything, but it was more convenient to have the book handy with an active dog. He already knew the basics of sitting, but then learned roll-over, playing dead, getting his toy, putting his toy away, getting my shoes, etc. I like that she includes troubleshooting as well. I probably should have bought a book on discipline as well, since the dog ate the cover of the book!
customer_reviews.author: B. K. Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to understand and teach
customer_reviews.text: This is the most simple training manual I have ever bought. It explains the tricks, how to teach them and gives pointers on possible solutions to common problems with each specific trick. Great pictures and illustrations. I also like that the tricks in the book are tricks listed by AKC for the "Tricks Training" certifications given by AKC. AKC has 5 Levels of 'Tricks certification' and all the tricks are taught in this book.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and a fun resource!
customer_reviews.text: Of course if you look hard enough you could probably easily find ways to train all of these tricks on YouTube or elsewhere - but it is very nice to have them all in one place without having to look up specifics! The instructions are easy to follow and simple to adjust for your dog if he/she doesn’t seem to be getting it. For me, it’s nice just to have so many ideas all in one place! If you are working for your trick dog title, or just want a fun way to exercise your dog’s brain and have some fun - this books is a blast!
customer_reviews.author: Winter

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful book!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new dog parent and bought this book after attending several in-person training courses. This book is easy to follow, and has step by step instructions. I know some of the reviews have said that it seems like it is missing key pieces of information, and I can understand that perspective. It really helps if you take a basic training course before using the book, as it will help give you a stronger foundation to use it. Kyra's training materials are top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Probst

customer_reviews.title: Has been super helpful
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought and read this book before I got my puppy, but recently decided to read it again. We haven't gotten down all of the tricks, but I'm confident with time we'll be able to. I like how the book tells you want to do, the gives you step by step instructions, followed by pictures to give you a visual. I'm a very visual person, so even though I read the guides, I find it easier to follow tte pictures and look at the queues that way. This is definitely worth the read.
customer_reviews.author: Yaas

customer_reviews.title: Dated and not good for small/medium dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This book is dated, and fairly useless for small dogs or dogs that are not athletic. Also, many of the use props, so you have to purchase them to do the tricks. For my small dogs, many of these tricks are impossible (jumping over me), and some require me to do headstands or somersaults. If you and your dog are athletic, keep in mind that the pictures are dated (like leg warmers and Velcro high tops). I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: E runner

customer_reviews.title: Logical, Lighthearted, seriously functional
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I bought this book. Wish I'd done it before I wasted $249 on a clicker training session with a "big shot" bitchy, trainer in the parking lot of a now defunct pet store where an extremely unfortunate parvo death occurred between lessons 1 & 2, handled by sending URGENT EMERGENCY, contact your vet emails (which got stuck in spam mail) to the other 5 class members.
customer_reviews.author: Eyecandy2

customer_reviews.title: Makes training your dog easy. I love the pictures that show you step ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes training your dog easy. I love the pictures that show you step by step how to teach your dog these tricks. I had purchased this books about 8 years ago and my teenage son was able to teach our previously hard to train pit bull so many tricks. We lost the book and I had to replace it because this books is invaluable to me and my family for all of our furry family members.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: The Very Best Dog Tricks Book
customer_reviews.text: Kyra is an awesome positive trainer who truly understands how dogs learn. Her enthusiasm is contagious and she is an outstanding teacher. She is the founder of Do More With Your Dog Trick Titling organization that this book is based on. Easy step by step training instructions with colorful photos showing what each trick looks like at every stage in the learning phase. This is by far the best book for dog training with categories of tricks suited for every dog and my absolute favorite in my Dog training library! I highly recommend this book and I show it and recommend it in all of my dog training classes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book would be perfect for someone training their dog for a show
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well written book with a lot of neat tricks. Over 60% of the tricks are things that I'd never use or train my dog to do (dancing, praying, hoops, etc.). This book would be perfect for someone training their dog for a show, but I didn't personally find it that useful in training my dog.
customer_reviews.author: gvstudent

customer_reviews.title: For newbie trainers without Internet skills; otherwise Google it
customer_reviews.text: Look online for this info for free. Nothing new here, instructions were brief. Might be appropriate for a child, complete newbie trainer, or someone without internet skills. Otherwise, just get this same info online in a variety of instructions for each trick/task. Not worth it if you have basic dog-training knowledge. Very brief instructions, lots of repetition, basic basic skills with a few exceptions. Needed lengthier descriptions, more pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Laura D.

customer_reviews.title: Fun activity for the dog
customer_reviews.text: There’s a lot of information about dog motivation and psychology. Most of the “tricks” are not things I’ll do with my Beagle, but it’s given me hope that he can be successful at least with the basics. I especially like that the author tells how long you can expect it to take for a dog to master a skill.
customer_reviews.author: Fritofan

customer_reviews.title: Great training book to have one hand
customer_reviews.text: I love having this book on hand for inspiration for trick training. I mostly use it to get ideas and look at suggested hand signals and cues. I end up teaching the tricks differently than suggested often. It’s not my favorite training book but has great pictures and I often flip through it when I’m deciding on a new trick to try.
customer_reviews.author: crystalpumpkinpup

customer_reviews.title: Great way to communicate with your pet!
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to understand book to guide the owner to train tricks to their dog. I loved it! However, some of the tricks are not applicable to short dogs...as with my four dachshunds. I gave this book to my 15 year old grandson to put to use with his standard poodle, and they recently won some ribbons in a competition!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Hurst

customer_reviews.title: the book is great. I wanted to exercise his mind with practical ...
customer_reviews.text: Look, if you want a show dog, the book is great. I wanted to exercise his mind with practical stuff. For example, would you want your dog to open the refrigerator? Really?
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: There is more to learn
customer_reviews.text: This is a great material to teach my dog additional tricks besides the basic obedience. Bonnie (my dog) has learned at least 25 tricks so far. Very impressive. The down side is when the tricks are getting harder, there is no additional explanations and sometimes it’s difficult for owners and dogs to move on. Anyway, still a good reference to use.
customer_reviews.author: Y Mac

customer_reviews.title: Taylor says high 5 up
customer_reviews.text: Really great book, from basics all the way to super challenging. My golden retriever is 1 and a half years old. He can distinguish left from right hands. I've had goldens all my life, this trainer has a different technique of teaching than I do. I think I'll need to learn her techniques in order to be able to do the more challenging tricks.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: This book is really REALLY cool! It helped me teach my puppy (5 months) ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is really REALLY cool! It helped me teach my puppy (5 months) quite a few tricks. The book walks you through step by step on how to teach the dog, and it makes it super fun for both of us. It does have a lot of advanced tricks that I'll have to teach her once she is older, or that I may never teach her because they are really advanced. But either way, it's a great book! My Mom even bought a copy after I showed her all the tricks that we learned. She is now teaching her 3yr old dog many tricks! :)
customer_reviews.author: Corri Glispey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing what dogs can do.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this book to my granddaughter for her birthday. Her family owns a German Shepherd and her plans for the summer are to teach him everything in this book. She's having fun, I don't know if he is or not, bu the knows more than he did when the summer started.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie

customer_reviews.title: Good for basic tricks, not much her for more experienced trainers.
customer_reviews.text: Good for basic tricks, but for those unskilled in actual dog training, I think the sparse instructions would be a problem. Lots of photos, so if you are a visual learner, it will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: pboy

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures, but I am not really a fan ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures, but I am not really a fan of using my hands on a dog to teach it things, I prefer shaping behaviors and positive reinforcement. Obviously the author's methods work for her and her amazing dog, just not quite what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Cant wait to start working on these tricks
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. Simply written and excellent ideas. I trick train now but needed more material to teach and came across this book. I am so excited to start teaching more tricks to my dogs. The each know about 25 so you run out of ideas.. This book is full of new ideas!
customer_reviews.author: lioness

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to use this book on my children.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! My Cookie is picking up very quickly! We have learned all the basics now to go on to the more challenging stuff. Love this book!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie D.

customer_reviews.title: Some great obedience stuff and tricks
customer_reviews.text: Some great obedience stuff and tricks. I was disappointed that the steps were not broken down more. They give you only a few steps to teach each trick. I have been training for awhile so not a bogg deal for me. If you are a beginner at training it might be frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: M  McClain

customer_reviews.title: is this book fun! The pictures are really amazing and it details ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, is this book fun! The pictures are really amazing and it details out the tricks so well. A lot of dog trick books try to show you how to teach the dog the trick but I always end up just staring at the page, reading the directions out loud and trying to read and teach my pup at the same time. Which usually ends up in her getting a free treat for doing nothing because I can't get it together. This book however, makes me feel like a boss when teaching her tricks. Maybe she'll start listening to me now...
customer_reviews.author: KinDC

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Written! Lots of Visuals!
customer_reviews.text: I love how each trick is written out and with verbal and visual clues. I realized that I taught the wrong cue for Paw,,,so am in the process of correcting that. I have a therapy dog that is a pug,,,so I am hoping this book will help me with more tricks than just the basics. I am very impressed with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blaauboer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good read for any dog owner, experienced or not.
customer_reviews.text: I've been involved with training dogs since I was a young girl, I used to want to be a veterinarian, but I don't have the stomach. This is a very good training book for tricks. I bought this book wondering if I would learn anything new, and while I knew the techniques used by this trainer, I didn't know the magnitude of tricks that you can teach to your dog. I have a very stubborn bullie so he's taking his time with learning, but definitely a good read for any dog owner, experienced or not.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Best dog trick book there is!
customer_reviews.text: I bought many other dog trick books and this was by far the best. It thought of MANY different kinds of tricks, not just the standard ones. It gave good pictures on how to do and lots of tricks I would never have thought of on how to get your dog to do something. For example using a sticky note to teach your dog to go stand in a corner. My dog learned it in one session. It teaches combinations of tricks like "get a beer from the fridge." It teaches some sport tricks and most of all, it gives advice on what happens when you try to do the trick but your dog does something wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful book, easy to follow and fun.
customer_reviews.text: Great book to teach your dog useful activities. My dog is a service animal and I did find the book helpful — it is not meant for service work, but body actions, etc. and to keep the dog learning, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Eisenhauer

customer_reviews.title: My dog and I are having fun with this book.
customer_reviews.text: What I like most about this book is the simplicity of the instructions. A trick is taught in segments. Once one part of the trick is learned, then another part is added on until the complete trick is learned. My dog and I are having fun with this book.
customer_reviews.author: marty

customer_reviews.title: A great book!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a dog you'd like to teach tricks, this is the book for you! The instructions are simple and logical, and there's pictures to help you along. My dog thrives on the one on one attention, treats and praise. The book is very well written, includes troubleshooting tips, more than one way to get a desired result and a healthy dose of humor. I first taught my dog to be ashamed (hide his head under a pillow). It was easy and he was doing it immediately. The best part is showing it to friends! I've been going through tricks since with great results. A wonderful book I would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: H Westover

customer_reviews.title: Well written and illustrated
customer_reviews.text: We got a lot of fun ideas for our dog from this book. I liked especially that beyond the basic commands you can randomly pick tricks from any page in the book. You chose to what level and time commitment you want to take the training. During this long, icy winter it helped keeping my dog entertained and we definitely bonded learning some of the tricks together. The pictures and descriptions are very good and easy to follow. I read in another review that this is the only dog training book you will need, and I tend to agree. It covers the basic commands very well, even if you don't want to do 'fancier' tricks with your dog.
customer_reviews.author: YpsiShopper

customer_reviews.title: the tips and tricks learned in this book have been extremely useful for teaching our fur baby better manners
customer_reviews.text: While we are not looking to raise a show dog, the tips and tricks learned in this book have been extremely useful for teaching our fur baby better manners. Thanks to the easy step by step guides (with photos) I am learning how to be a better leader while he is gaining a more solid understanding of the basics--and catching on quicker to the fun tricks. Now, he delights us and guests with his tricks--and we are proud of what a smart dog he is. Great book, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: SALove

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have very many tricks that I would actually want to try.
customer_reviews.author: DDemarest

customer_reviews.title: Great training info for teaching your dog tricks
customer_reviews.text: I have a service dog I am training top pick up the lead when I drop it and hand it to me so I don't have to bend over so far. (Broken back twice). We are having a lot of fun training our Standard Poodles with this book.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma LOVES to climb trees

customer_reviews.title: This is more for advanced dogs.
customer_reviews.text: These tricks are for advanced dogs that have some heavy duty tricks worked out already. There are not enough steps to teach most of the tricks.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Dogs and Owners
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great opportunity to learn with your dog. The tricks are broken down into easy steps and offer great options for common issues that come up in the learning process. I would happily recommend this book to anyone interested in dog tricks.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow instructions. Lots of fun to try the various tricks, especially when dog is bored and can't get outside enough due to bad weather. Occupy her mind and tires her out mentally to learn the tricks. Just takes patience and lots of practice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not my style
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking book, but did not work for me or my puppy. The intro was the most helpful part, with behavior and vocabulary advise. As a first-time puppy owner, these tricks were too challenging for me to complete in the ways described (putting him into positions). I had much more success with a video called "Puppy Academy." It is corny and takes awhile to get to the point, but it's teaching style is geared towards total novices with new puppies. It focuses on rewarding the dog for what he is naturally doing or getting his body into position in a much easier way.
customer_reviews.author: Della

customer_reviews.title: 101 Dog Tricks
customer_reviews.text: This is a very informative book to enlighten you with steps and procedures to help you help your dog understand what you want and how to achieve results. I recently adopted an adult Doberman Pincher that was in serious need or retraining (or modify behavior). This book has given me the clues to having a wonderful companion that understands what I want of him. Kyra Sundance - Thank you for all your help with this. Pamela
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Book
customer_reviews.text: I have only begun with the basics (sit, stay, come), but I feel I can say something about the book. There are clear, easy to read, short, step-by-step instructions. There are lots of photos showing how to go about it. The common hand signals are also shown! There are short summaries of what to expect when your dog masters the command. There are plenty of tricks further into the book, I may or may not get to some of them. I saw that some tricks have prerequisites, and they are listed clearly so you can do them first. Everything is very clear and easy, which is perfect for this type of book.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Good for Training in AKC Programs too
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book because it recognizes the step-by-step nature of training. There is a difference between training and learning; the majority of animals are trained because the motivation for learning is (usually) beyond their cognitive abilities. Additionally, there are good training tips in here if you wanted to advance your dog thru the obedience levels such as Companion Dog X, Utility Dog or other higher levels of skill. It would be nice to address the personality needed to be a dog trainer. Not a lot of individuals possess the incredible amount of patience and perserverence working with animals requires. If you are looking for a quick fix---not a chance. Neither animals nor life in general works that way.
customer_reviews.author: ChefCheyanne

customer_reviews.title: Outdated and more like an informational book for the authors gain!
customer_reviews.text: I don't get all the high five star reviews for this book. It is really outdated and if you asked me it was written with too much information about the author. Written for the authors gain if you ask me. I would recommend another book. Ms Sundance is way to much into herself.
customer_reviews.author: Kipper

customer_reviews.title: Good "show tricks"
customer_reviews.text: Good "show tricks", many of which are geared for more advanced performance, while I wanted more common household "games". Some of the tricks were not suitable for a dog (puppy) like mine who would cause more trouble by learning to open the refrigerator (and get more than a can of beer) or eating the contents and box of tissues instead of putting them in the wastebasket. This book may be more useful to me in the future when my puppy has settled down a bit and I have limbered up for some of the tricks. There are also many props to obtain which are needed for some of the tricks.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BOOK! This book is great for teaching your ...
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME BOOK! This book is great for teaching your dog tricks!!!! Step by step for even the youngest trainers out there. Unique tricks to teach your fur baby. It's not just the basic ones....examples: saying prayers, putting toys away, doing chores etc...big bright illustrations!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Good training companion
customer_reviews.text: I've not gone all the way through this book, but so far my new rescue, Bella, has mastered sit, shake and down. Still learning stay (depends on if she gets distracted), roll over (sometimes does not complete and I have to help her to complete) and sit-up is a struggle since she has a sloppy sitting style. The instructions and photos are clear and helpful. Due to my lack of interest in wanting a show-quality dog, I'm confident we won't tackle every trick in the book, but I'm appreciative of what I'm able to pick and choose throughout the book. Good purchase, no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: DeeTee

customer_reviews.title: Not for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for ideas of cute tricks that I could teach my Pomeranian, but he is too small to achieve most of them. Many of these "tricks" aren't actually tricks but how to train your dog to do agility etc. when I was expecting individual behaviors that I could teach. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Frank White

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand and follow!
customer_reviews.text: I think Kyra Sundance is training her readers as well as her dogs! If you've ever wondered how to get your dog to do a particular trick, this book is all you'll need to understand how to do it. She gives the basic tricks through advanced, tells you how to build on tricks, and even includes tips for coming up with your own tricks based on behaviors your dog already likes doing. The pictures and wording of the book are simple and very easy to understand. If Kyra could only teach my dog to read it and do the tricks herself...! Worth the money, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kath DK

customer_reviews.title: Great to teach tricks to your dog.
customer_reviews.text: This book is great for teaching tricks. It acks the most important stuff to teach your dog how to behave, like how to walk on a leash or how to potty train.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan P

customer_reviews.title: A really practical guide
customer_reviews.text: This guide has great illustrations and practical tips for training your dog to do new tricks. Our dog has already mastered several, and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth P.

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loved her gift
customer_reviews.text: It looked like fun book for my granddaughter who has a new dog that she expect to show in 4H as a dog project. This little Corgie needs a great deal of work to help her focus on something other than her big dog attitude in a small dog body.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri B.

customer_reviews.title: Very understandable and very useful! Ok
customer_reviews.text: Very understandable and very useful! Ok, if you would like to change a behavior of your dog, you need something else, but if you want to help your dog more smarter and obtain more interesting friend - this book will help you.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Get Book for Easy Tricks
customer_reviews.text: Taught my 6m old puppy how to rollover with this books easy instructions. Wouldn't bother getting the puppy book however, a lot of the tricks are the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The written directions are easy to follow with photos of each step of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is fabulous! Tricks are organized by difficulty level near the back of the book. The written directions are easy to follow with photos of each step of the trick. My dog is a fast learner and could already do 10 tricks before prior to reading this book. It's fun to teach him something new to keep him engaged and always learning.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Recommended purchase for any serious dog owner
customer_reviews.text: Interesting and worthwhile! A lot of the tricks are spinoffs of classical obedience, but that's not bad. A worthwhile purchase for any serious dog owner. I taught my dog to do "the leap of death" (through a hula hoop covered with tissue paper). Every dog needs a trick. You'll find lots of them here.
customer_reviews.author: Clear Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and follow
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and follow. I got this for my kids to use to teach our new pup some tricks. They are age 9 and 11 and can follow the instructions in this book. So far, it works! The pup has learned to sit, stay, shake, lay down, beg, and a couple of others.
customer_reviews.author: Souperbeck

customer_reviews.title: great training book
customer_reviews.text: this book tells you exactly how to train your dog. now my dog is a well behaved companion. This book was a tremendous help.
customer_reviews.author: tom perkins

customer_reviews.title: Probably the only book you will need on dog tricks
customer_reviews.text: I received this today and it was so easy to use that I already taught my dog a trick! It literally took me 5 minutes. It was an easy one though--wave goodbye. But the instructions were easy to follow and the pictures really helped too. It even told me how to fix a roadblock and it worked immediately. I can't wait to teach her how to pick up her toys!
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Worked immediately.
customer_reviews.text: My weimaraner has never been able to learn fetch or shake. Within minutes of trying both of those with him he immediately got the concept and has not forgotten with regular reinfocement. We are working our way up to more complicated "tricks" but I found the training methods very helpful and effective. On one or two I wished for a better description or pictures of what to do, but overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Orange Crush

customer_reviews.title: Visual instructions, great results
customer_reviews.text: Anyone with a dog can teach these tricks to their furry buddy. Very visual with concise advice. There is also a Facebook group that expands the how-to of each trick in case your dog didn’t read the book. A win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Schipperke mom

customer_reviews.title: terrible book
customer_reviews.text: the tricks in here are just ridiculous. Unless you own a circus I suggest you purchase something else
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: My dog learned stay in 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: After reading this it took 5 minutes and a couple of dog snacks to make her understand. Before this book I had tried a lot of things to make my dog to understand the "stay" command with no good results. All I could get from my dog was a lot of funny puzzled looking faces and she used to get very frustrated with my continuous corrections. One time the poor dog even started to scratch her face and make weird noises. I recommend this book and also the dog whisperer's book to understand how to get a good comunication with your dog. Now my dog is a happy dog.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Key Martinez Barragan

customer_reviews.title: Mixed signals?!
customer_reviews.text: Was excited after seeing the review about all the copies sold. But was turned off in the basic obedience section where the author felt the need to use FORCE on dogs for such basic commands really didn’t get much further in after seeing her use manual corrections.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod Fassler

customer_reviews.title: I love the way this book is presented
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this book is presented. I bought it with the intention of picking out a few tricks and working on them slowly with our 5 month old GSD. However, my seven year old started flipping through the pages, and because of the easy to follow steps and pictures, she started working on various tricks with the puppy and now it is her favorite thing to do after school. It's been a great bonding tool for the two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Hc

customer_reviews.title: Better information online for free.
customer_reviews.text: Very basic, does not go into great detail about the tricks or ways to help you dog achieve them.
customer_reviews.author: AQ

customer_reviews.title: The best way to have fun with your dog
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome book. Clearly the Dog Trick Bible. No matter who you are, no matter what kind of dog you have, you both will be able to ace some of these tricks. I love how the author put it all together with clear and concise instructions and plenty of pictures. I liked it so much I bought the paperback to keep in the family room and the Kindle version to have it always ready wherever I go.
customer_reviews.author: TrixseaB

customer_reviews.title: Practical and Realistic
customer_reviews.text: I have read several books on dog training and have been busy watching youtube videos in anticipation of getting our new dog. Most books spent too much time on philosophy and theory. IN this book, the introduction alone wraps up better what all of the other books try to say in volumes. This book gives short practical approaches to each trick with great pictures for verbal and physical cues. It is not about being silly, it is about being consistent and practical in your dog training.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Fun, easy and rewarding!
customer_reviews.text: This book is so much fun! I bought it because I wasn't able to drive to my dog's regular training course. So, we started practicing tricks indoor. The instructions are easy to follow, and the bond you create with your dog makes this book so worthwhile. I would highly recommend it if you're looking for a way to train your dog on your own, save money and build a lasting relationship.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great book with neat tricks and helpful instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Really great book with neat tricks and very helpful instructions. We got this for our daughter and her 1 and a half year old Pointer Mix and they have benefited from having the book. She's learn quite of few of these tricks and now has even learned how to turn out the lights!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur family

customer_reviews.title: Very easy for her to understand
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old daughter and her yellow lab are using this book! Very easy for her to understand, and it has lots of pictures! Highly recommend to any dog lover!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Weink

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My kids love picking out a trick from this book and getting my German shepherd to do it in as little as 3 tries! Book tells you tip that are very helpful in training your dog new tricks
customer_reviews.author: Members

customer_reviews.title: Cute ideas
customer_reviews.text: Great ideas for tricks. Not as good as having a trainer to help problem solve. But if you have a dog who is well-trained with a trainer and you are well-trained on training it is great! Lots of fun things to do with the dog in the cold winter months coming up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: It is really a beginner book.The first chapter explains that if your dog already knows some commands you may get in to trouble. This is only because of the words you chose to teach the command, it may be different from what is suggested. For example, I used 'wait' to teach my dog stay instead of 'stay' or 'heel'. All in all this book is very clear. Each trick gets 1-2 pages with written explanation, step by step instructions, and color photos. Will be a great reference. I foster dogs and teaching them neat tricks always helps with the adoption process.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Candy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT book on dog training!
customer_reviews.text: One person wrote that it wasn't the best book on dog training. Honestly, I don't know how it could be any better. And the photos are incredible. I am blown away by the amount of time and work and quality this book represents. I am thoroughly enjoying it and hopefully my smart puppy will be soon. The instructions seems straight forward and logical and doable. I would highly recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: Jean B. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow tricks for our new puppy!
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a puppy recently but didn't know how to teach her some tricks. The book is nicely written, lessons are detailed and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Borrero

customer_reviews.title: Breaks each step down with pictures
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this book! Simple instructions: breaks each trick down into steps. My Aussie earned 4 trick dog titles with the help of this book and we are working on our next trick title.
customer_reviews.author: Aussieagilitymom

customer_reviews.title: Trick Dog Alert
customer_reviews.text: This book is a staple for the rapidly growing Trick Dog title collected through Do More With Your Dog (the originator) or the AKC. A must have book if you are into this particular sport.
customer_reviews.author: littljeane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest book ever my dog has learned so many tricks out of this book buy it. The step by step instructions are so easy to follow. If you are a professional trainer or just want your dog to do some tricks this door is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A. Gant

customer_reviews.title: do not recommend! this is NOT a R+ training book
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited for this book until it arrived. Dogs (like humans) learn from clear and consistent communication and they should be motivated with treats. Using force to get a dog into any position is aversive. Books like this are dangerous and reinforce harmful myths about dogs.
customer_reviews.author: AMW

customer_reviews.title: This was a very good book, though it could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This was an extremely helpful training book, though it could be better.It gives very clear step by step instructions with descriptive pictures.In the front section it explains what to use for training materials.The reason I gave this book a 4 star is because there was often a time when couldn't understand how to teach a trick because it lacked instructions.Though overall it was a good book.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle L.

customer_reviews.title: Helpful tips in teaching tricks!
customer_reviews.text: My pup ironically trying to destroy her training book as pictured haha! I really do like this book though and it helps explain in what way to lure the treat to get the dog to do the trick, etc. I definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JaclynB

customer_reviews.title: I REALLY like this book
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY like this book. I am actually adept with dog training but bought this for the more advanced tricks. However, I have found that it gives some alternate ideas on training that can produce quicker results. Highly recommend this for anyone who wants that dog everybody loves.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Tips and Tricks
customer_reviews.text: This book has everything you would want to teach your dog! The interactive pictures really help with training as well. Trick training is a fun way to keep your dog entertained and learning new things
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog was born smart. This was the cram of the crop!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is an English Short haired Pointer. A.K.A. "Bird Bog" She has learned so many tricks out of this book it's awesome. But the BEST PART is each command comes with a sign language command. So I don't have to say a word on 90% of the tricks. I do a whole routine, even point my finger like a gun and she "Plays Dead". Like an actress! I post them all on Facebook!!!! Worth buying?? Yes 100%.. Especially is you have a puppy 3 months to a year. But my 8 year old is also picking up the tricks well. And she is in routine with my 11 month old... Great book. Great hand signals!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great content and illustrations
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is full of more content than I will probably ever be able to get through. But it is well organized, many pictures to illustrate teaching techniques. My son and I love reading it together. Great book for a kid to easily read. Makes it a family training event!
customer_reviews.author: JAC0924

customer_reviews.title: The directions are easy to follow and effective
customer_reviews.text: Although I had planned to teach my two dogs many of these tricks (never got around to it), the 4 or 5 that I did teach them they still do to this day (6 years ago). The directions are easy to follow and effective. When I get out the "cookies" they still immediately do "CIRCLES" lol
customer_reviews.author: Kim Neske

customer_reviews.title: Get that ball!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of tricks that I probably would never attempt...more for "acts". The directions are few and I have tried a couple. The comments about troubles was more helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting a little less difficult tricks, the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a little less difficult tricks, the hoop and other tricks are rather difficult if you only have a couple of hours a day tops to practice with your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good condition and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Good condition and fast shipping. I enjoy the dog tricks, but I wish they would've avoided the super obvious and easy tricks as those tricks are in every single dog trick book/website/person you talk to and therefore are just wasted pages in this book. The other tricks though are very interesting and innovative.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie W.

customer_reviews.title: We are having a lot more fun
customer_reviews.text: Well worth using with my Lab. We are having a lot more fun together
customer_reviews.author: D. Lantz

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BOOK!
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me and just got a new high energy puppy GET THIS BOOK! I have a border terrier puppy that has learned more things from this book than the in home trainer we have. It does require a lot of patients to get some of the tricks right and in some cases it might take your dog a few days to fully get a trick right. but the pay off is so worth it! when i go the book he was about two months old and now he is six months and we are already half way through the book! Its a great feeling to see your dog succeed and this book has defiantly help us.
customer_reviews.author: linds

product_meta.title: 101 Dog Tricks: Step by Step Activities to Engage, Challenge, and Bond with Your Dog (Dog Tricks and Training)
